@Jomckee131144 So sorry you are going through this! Are you getting any support from organisations like @tymestrust or @actionforme ?
@MorrisonBeth It sounds like the school (I'm guessing they are mainstream) don't know how to support this pupil and therefore don't want him there (this happened to my son many years ago).

RT @helpusfindowami: Day 46 has come and gone, still no news at all. Where is Owami? 
Have you seen Owami Davies? Please DM me if you have‚Ä¶

@MorrisonBeth That's incredible! It shouldn't be happening at all, but where is the compassion & understanding that the return to school causes great stress & anxiety for some kids leading to "challenging" behaviours?

RT @helpusfindowami: Day #45

Owami is still missing. Thank you to everyone that has been retweeting, reposting, talking about her, looking‚Ä¶

@endseclusion Trying to make it sond like a hug? And for some kids touch of any kind isn't a good thing so it isn't going to be calming.

@Lisa_SEND Rhus Tox homeopathic tablets- they're tiny and can be chewed.

@LongCovidKids This is how my sister and I used to react to every virus we got. This kid's blood vessels are dilating and the blood is pooling in their legs/feet. They need to get their feet raised asap! Then look into antihistmines.
@theautismpage My son has loved songs since he was tiny & still enjoys singing as an adult.
@SensorySp My son used to be able to cope with small supermarkets if we went while they were quiet, but as he got older he struggled more with them, so now no longer goes to any shops.
@LucySanctuary Perhaps it just makes their life easier. In my son's experience it was easier to exclude him for being aggressive than to change what they were doing.

@LucySanctuary Such a common scenario. Sadly some (many?) professionals find it easier to blame and put pressure on parents, rather than try to see things from the child's perspective and be willing to make adaptations to help child & parents.
@trishgreenhalgh Intersting article here about Greys v Reds https://t.co/F12WG42JhF
@BeckyMakaton A very tricky one indeed, but you've done it really well!
